revised_title: Regeneration of Excitatory, Inhibitory, and Biphasic Synaptic Connections in a Snail Giant Interneuron
tldr: This study examines the regeneration of excitatory, inhibitory, and biphasic synaptic connections made by a snail giant interneuron. The research shows that the regenerating fibers can reform specific synaptic connections in a highly reliable manner, with responses first appearing at about three days after axonal section. The postsynaptic responses eventually become strong and regular, similar to the undamaged cell.
